q_en: Which workgroup has the highest remaining workload for all sewing tasks that have been started but not yet completed?
gt:
Hey there! ğŸ˜„ Let's dive into the world of sewing tasks and see which workgroup is leading the pack with the highest remaining workload. Here's what we found:

| Workgroup Name  | Remaining Workload |
|-----------------|--------------------|
| Master Sewers   | 40                 |

The "Master Sewers" workgroup has the highest remaining workload for all sewing tasks that have been started but not yet completed. Keep up the great work, Master Sewers! ğŸ§µâœ¨

steps.sql: SELECT id, name FROM working_group WHERE type = 'sew';
steps.description: Retrieve the IDs and names of all working groups

steps.sql: SELECT working_group_id, SUM(planned_number) AS total_planned, SUM(completed_number) AS total_completed FROM sewing_tasks WHERE status = 1 GROUP BY working_group_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total planned and completed numbers for all started but not completed sewing tasks

steps.sql: SELECT wg.name, (st.total_planned - st.total_completed) AS remaining_workload FROM (SELECT working_group_id, SUM(planned_number) AS total_planned, SUM(completed_number) AS total_completed FROM sewing_tasks WHERE status = 1 GROUP BY working_group_id) st JOIN working_group wg ON st.working_group_id = wg.id ORDER BY remaining_workload DESC LIMIT 1;
steps.description: Calculate the remaining workload for each working group and identify the one with the highest remaining workload
